page.title: 06RELIGION IN SHILLINGSTONE
page.content: In the area there are a number of churches and chapels.Each village has a church which dates back to the time of the original Domesday Book.Shillingstone and Child Okeford each have a United Reform Church which was originally a Methodist Chapel. At Shillingstone there is also a Gospel Hall,which was a wooden hut in an orchard until 1927,when it was replaced by the present brick building.The Shillingstone chapel was built in 1904,replacing an earlier building in Hine Town lane,dating from 1853.Shillingstone Church dates from Saxon times;the present building from the 13c.A Saxon head of Christ is over the porch and an ancient altar stone on the west wall of the nave.There are Norman windows in the nave,discovered when the church was restored in 1858.
